title._content: Private ‘Snowy’ Alderson and the farming family he worked with

description._content: ID number: P05142.001 Photographer: Unknown Date Made: 1941-1944 Germany: Informal group portrait of NX6320 (POW Number 09573) Private (Pte) Alan Chambers 'Snowy' Alderson, 2/1 Field Ambulance (far right, holding rake), with the German farming family with whom he worked whilst a prisoner of war (POW). Pte Alderson, a lorry driver of Alexandria, NSW, enlisted at Marrickville NSW, on 27 October 1939 and embarked for service overseas on 10 January 1940. On 15 October 1941 he was officially reported at Stalag XIIIc camp at Hohenfels, Germany, where he remained until November 1943 when he was repatriated, probably a prisoner exchange due to ill health. He was discharged medically unfit in Australia on 11 November 1944, aged 25. Rights Info: No known copyright restrictions. This photograph is from the Australian War Memorial's collection www.awm.gov.au Persistent URL: www.awm.gov.au/collection/P05142.001
